title: Council Regulation (EEC) No 3644/90 of 11 December 1990 amending Regulation (EEC) No 985/68 laying down general rules for intervention on the market in butter and cream
header:
COUNCIL REGULATION (EEC) N° 3644/90 of 11 December 1990 amending Regulation (EEC) N° 985/68 laying  down general rules for intervention on the market in butter and cream
THE COUNCIL  OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community,
Having regard to the Act of Accession of Spain and Portugal, and in particular Article 234 (2)  thereof,
Having regard to the proposal from the Commission,
Whereas Article 1 (3) (b) of Regulation (EEC) N° 985/68(1), as last amended by Regulation (EEC) N°  1185/90(2), defines the grading of butter which may be bought in by the intervention agencies of  different Member States; whereas the aforesaid provision should be adapted so as to introduce grading for Portuguese butter,
main_body:
The following indent is added to Article 1 (3) (b) of Regulation  (EEC) N° 985/68:
'Product made entirely from pasteurized cows' milk or cream as regards Portuguese butter.`

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 January 1991.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all  Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 11 December 1990.
For the CouncilThe PresidentV. SACCOMANDI
(1)OJ N° L 169, 18. 7. 1968, p. 1.
(2)OJ N° L 119, 11. 5. 1990, p. 31.
